shelf_life.notes: Retains 90% capacity after 10 years at room temperature

current_capability.notes: Excellent pulse current capability for camera flash applications

construction.equivalent: Roughly equivalent to 4 AA batteries in terms of capacity

form_factor.camera_specific: Designed specifically for camera battery compartments
form_factor.space_efficient: High capacity in compact camera-friendly format

safety_notes: Avoid extreme temperatures during high-drain use
High current capability - handle connections carefully

performance_characteristics.voltage_stability: Excellent - maintains 3V throughout most of discharge
performance_characteristics.temperature_performance: Superior performance in cold conditions vs alkaline
performance_characteristics.flash_capability: Optimized for camera flash high-current pulses

replacement_options.rechargeable_equivalent: Some cameras accept rechargeable Li-ion packs in same form factor
replacement_options.aa_adapter: Some cameras can use AA battery adapters instead
replacement_options.notes: Check camera manual for compatibility with alternatives

market_status.availability: Less common as digital cameras evolved to use proprietary Li-ion packs
market_status.legacy_support: Still manufactured for older camera models
market_status.cost: Premium pricing due to specialized nature

comparison_to_alternatives.vs_4xaa: Same voltage, higher capacity, much more compact
comparison_to_alternatives.vs_cr123a: Higher capacity, different form factor, camera-optimized
comparison_to_alternatives.vs_proprietary_lion: Non-rechargeable, longer shelf life, wider temperature range

notes: Specialized battery format designed for digital cameras requiring high capacity and pulse current capability. The rectangular form factor maximizes capacity while fitting camera battery compartments. Largely superseded by proprietary Li-ion packs but still used in some camera models.
